overview:
Eric Gatz is the Co-Founder and CEO of cubTales.com

Eric graduated in 1998 with a degree in Compute Science from the University at Albany. Straight out of college Eric went to work as a Support Specialist for the international bank Schroder Wertheim.

Right about this time the Interweb was taking off and Eric was looking to be a part of it. In late 1999 he landed a Systems Administrator job with Flooz.com. From the inside of their data center Eric helped to build Flooz’s technical infrastructure and really got to feel the rush of a startup. The excitement of these times appealed to him and it was here he decided one day to start his own venture.

After the bursting of the bubble in 2001 Eric found a job at the national sales rep firm National Cable Communications (owned by Time Warner, Cox & Comcast). At NCC Eric learned how to manage, how to create and maybe most importantly how to inspire. Although these traits are not always appreciated in the “corporate world” Eric had his sights set on putting them to good use with cubTales.com.
